questions.full_question_text: An aircraft flying in Summer season from Delhi to Kolkata at 10 km will experience
The occurrence of large deserts near 30N and 30S are due to large scale
A part of the sinking air over the subtropical high flows towards the equator, turning west (in the northern hemisphere) due to the Coriolis force. This surface air is called
The validity of Landing Forecast (TREND) is
Relative humidity depends on
options: moisture content and pressure of the air
moisture content of the air only
moisture content and temperature of the air
questions.solution: moisture content and temperature of the air

questions.full_question_text: Which of the following conditions is most likely to lead to the formation of advection fog?
options: Moist cold air moving over a warm surface
Moist warm air moving over a cold surface
Dry warm air moving over a cold surface
Dry cold air moving over a warm surface
questions.solution: Moist warm air moving over a cold surface

questions.full_question_text: Low level wind shear is likely to be greatest
options: at the condensation level when there is no night radiation
at the condensation level when there is strong surface friction.
at the top of a marked surface-based inversion.
at the top of the friction layer.
questions.solution: at the top of a marked surface-based inversion.

questions.full_question_text: Where is a squall line to be expected?
options: In front of an active cold front.
In front of a cold front occlusion at higher levels.
At the surface position of a warm front.
questions.solution: In front of an active cold front.

questions.full_question_text: Which constant pressure altitude chart is standard for a 18289 FT pressure level (FL 180)?
Advection fog occurs due to ___ air moving over ___ surface over ___
options: Moist and cold, warm, land only
Warm & moist air, cold, both land & sea
questions.solution: Warm & moist air, cold, both land & sea
